divs: Sighting DetailsWhile driving home that night, I noticed a brilliant red, round object in the sky. It was in the southern sky, just sitting motionless. At that distance in the sky (it was up in the sky, not at the horizon) it looked like a solid red, but it was "twinkling". I watched it for 10 minutes while driving home. When I looked away for a while, then looked back up, it was gone. It was not a plane: it did not move in a pattern like a plane, it did not have the white and red blinking landing lights, it never came in closer than where it sat for a touchdown (Note: I go by DFW Airport every day and watch the planes coming in for landings) and it was round. It was not a planet: it was too big, too brilliant and the wrong color red. It never moved the entire time I watched it. It was stationary. I did not think anything about it until I heard about the Stephanville sightings (and other sightings at surrounding communities). I felt I should report this sighting as it was close enough to those communities to be related.
